clientInfo.name: Caelan Urquhart
clientInfo.title: Co-founder | Scaling data & CI pipelines @ Pipekit

keyHighlights: Top performing post achieved 58 likes from a text post.
Text posts dominate the content mix at 85.71% of total posts.
Thursday posts receive the highest engagement with a multiplier of 1.38.
Audience composition shows diversity with 48.51% categorized as Others.
executiveSummary.summaryText: This report analyzes LinkedIn engagement for Caelan Urquhart over May 2025, integrating metrics on likes, and comments. It provides insights on content types, posting patterns, and audience composition. The analysis highlights that text posts prevail and that Thursday posts drive superior engagement. Strategic recommendations are provided to optimize content strategy and posting schedule.

contentAnalysis.visualImpactInsight: All posts are text-based with consistent engagement at an average of 30 likes, indicating a reliance on non-visual content.
contentAnalysis.postTypeDistributionInsight: Text posts dominate the content mix, comprising 85.71% of posts.

topPerformingPosts.content: Launch alert! Are you a developer working with Argo, Kubernetes, data pipelines, or LLMs? My co-founder J.P. Zivalich and I are excited to announce 6 new service offerings at Pipekit.

Hey, folks! If you're going to be at #KubeCon NA in Chicago this year, I hope you can stop by my talk happening during #ArgoCon. I’ll be doing a deep dive comparing Argo and Jenkins for CI/CD pipelines with Bertrand Quenin from Intuit.
Great first day at KubeCon's main event in London! Love meeting up with our team and customers in person to nerd out on Argo & K8s.

Experiment alert: I’m starting to notice that financial services companies like banks, fintech, hedge funds, etc. seem to love Pipekit more than any other cohort. I’m now trying to see how we can find more companies that could be a fit.

topIndustryInfluencersAnalysis.overview: Analysis of 4 industry influencers with an average of 49,725 followers reveals diverse content strategies and engagement patterns in the data + AI space.

influencers.name: Ali Ghodsi
influencers.title: CEO & Co-Founder at Databricks, Adjunct Professor at UC Berkeley
influencers.descriptionFocus: CEO & Co-Founder at Databricks, focusing on distributed systems and big data solutions.

profile.name: Ali Ghodsi
profile.title: CEO & Co-Founder at Databricks, Adjunct Professor at UC Berkeley

post.text:
In just two weeks, we revolutionized Dolly. Introducing the first open source, instruction-following LLM, fine-tuned on a human-generated instruction dataset licensed for commercial use. 

With Dolly 2.0, any organization can create, own, and customize a powerful LLM without sharing their proprietary data with 3rd parties or paying for API access. The model uses a new dataset, “databricks-dolly-15k,” which is made up of more than 15,000 records generated by thousands of Databricks employees. It’s the first open source, human-generated instruction dataset specifically designed to make LLMs exhibit the magical interactivity of ChatGPT (instruction following). 

We’re open-sourcing the entirety of Dolly 2.0, including the training code, dataset, and model weights, all suitable for commercial use.

https://bit.ly/43oXmsy 

#llm #dolly #lakehouse #databricks

influencers.name: Barr Moses
influencers.title: Co-Founder & CEO at Monte Carlo
influencers.descriptionFocus: CEO at Monte Carlo, building data observability solutions to ensure data and AI reliability.

post.text:
Who owns data quality? 

It’s a question as old as Oracle Version 3, and the answer varies depending on who you ask.

- Some organizations like to spread the responsibility around to multiple team members, each responsible for a few pipelines. 

- Others prefer to concentrate the responsibility on a select few specialists who have a holistic view of the entire platform. 

- And then there are those who view data quality as a technical issue, while others see it as a business or process problem.

But at the end of the day, the only thing that matters is that it gets done. 

Shane Murray and I have spoken to thousands of data leaders over the years to understand the most common ownership models for data quality, and how data teams can apply them at scale.

From data engineering to data governance teams, our latest explores the pros and cons of each approach: https://lnkd.in/eiUPWypC

(Meme inspired by Chad Sanderson)

#dataquality #dataengineering #datareliability

influencers.name: Ketan U.
influencers.title: Co-Founder and CEO at Union.ai | Flyte.org
influencers.descriptionFocus: CEO at Union.ai and Flyte.org with deep expertise in distributed algorithms, Kubernetes, and cloud systems.

profile.name: Ketan U.
profile.title: Co-Founder and CEO at Union.ai | Flyte.org

post.text:
It was a fanboy moment this week for me. I had an opportunity to meet Jensen Huang at the Nvidia HQ. There is something different about him, smart, assured and ready to dive deep into almost any technical topic. To have this passion and energy for 3 decades is applaudable.

Previously I also had a chance to interact with Jeff Bezos and he had a similar personality. These gentleman have achieved so much, created great businesses, but their technical acumen and hunger remains unsatiated.

influencers.name: Maxime Beauchemin
influencers.title: CEO & Founder at Preset
influencers.descriptionFocus: CEO & Founder at Preset and creator of Apache Airflow; a key influencer in data pipeline orchestration and open source innovation.

post.text:
Today we're announcing #apachesuperset 1.0 and our graduation from the incubator at the Apache Software Foundation! 

1.0 is a huge milestone and marks the point where #opensource #businessintelligencebi  is truly ready for mass adoption!

hashtagPerformanceAnalysis.hashtagKeyFinding: Posts with hashtags have lower usage rate overall but when used, drive significant engagement, as shown by an average of 45 engagement per hashtag post.

influencerComparison.name: Maxime Beauchemin
influencerComparison.topThemes: Open source innovator & Data engineering expertise

summaryOfComparison: The client shows consistent engagement with a strong focus on text-based posts, while influencers demonstrate varied content strategies with higher posting frequencies and diversified content types. To improve competitive positioning, the client could increase content variety and posting frequency.

gapAnalysis.gap: Lower posting frequency compared to influencers
gapAnalysis.recommendedAction: Increase posting frequency to at least 1 post per week.

gapAnalysis.influencerAverage: Mix of images, videos, and articles
gapAnalysis.recommendedAction: Incorporate visual and multimedia content to enhance engagement.

recommendations.contentStrategy: Diversify content themes to include more multimedia and interactive posts.
recommendations.visualElements: Introduce high-quality images and videos to complement text content.
recommendations.postingSchedule: Post more consistently, aiming for at least one post per week during peak engagement times.
recommendations.audienceTargeting: Engage a broader audience by tailoring content to different industry segments.
recommendations.engagementTactics: Incorporate calls-to-action and interactive elements to foster audience interaction.
